name: netWell HealthShare
statementOfFaith: Statement of Religious and Ethical Beliefs based on Christian principles (1 John 4:21, Galatians 6:2): belief in the God of the Bible, duty to love and accept one another, obligation to live a healthy lifestyle, ethical responsibility to carry each other's burdens.

preExisting.sharingLimits: Full exclusion during 24-month waiting period, then fully shareable. Cancer: 90-day waiting period.

processingTime: Claims must be filed within 90 days
bestFor: Budget-conscious individuals seeking affordable health sharing without strict religious requirements
pros: No strict faith requirement — most inclusive healthshare for non-religious or non-Christian members
Affordable catastrophic coverage starting at ~$144/month (Advantage plan)
Large First Health/PHCS/MultiPlan network with 1M+ providers
Generous netWellRx prescription discount program (600+ free generics for $19.95/month add-on)
Year-round open enrollment (no annual enrollment windows)
cons: Very poor member satisfaction (2.2/5 Trustpilot, 1.63/5 BBB reviews) with frequent claim complaints
24-month pre-existing condition waiting period — among the longest in the industry
Not available in 4 states (CA, MD, VT, WA)
aiSummary: netWell HealthShare is a Christian-light health sharing ministry founded in 2020 in Austin, TX with approximately 25,000 members. It offers two plans: Advantage (catastrophic, starting at $144/mo, $250K annual cap) and Elite+ (comprehensive, starting at $269/mo, $1M annual cap). Uses First Health/PHCS/MultiPlan network with 1M+ providers. Requires agreement with Christian-based Statement of Beliefs but no specific denomination or church attendance required. BBB accredited with A rating since 2024, but poor member satisfaction scores. 24-month pre-existing condition waiting period. Not available in CA, MD, VT, WA.
aiKeyFacts: Not available in CA, MD, VT, WA
